body:
### Problem

Creating a relative floating window when on another tab page, creates the floating window for the current tab page, instead of the actual tab page for the one where the actual window is located. Further more going to the first tab page where the target window is actually located, has no floating window.

Another issue is that for some reason the tab page is obscured, rendered under the floating window, when the floating window is shown / rendered for the first time
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/15955811/1db1d06d-b145-40cf-9f85-212452b9d954)
 
If you go to the first tab page, then go back to the second the tab page line is correctly rendered above and not overlapping with the floating window.
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/15955811/01badc8c-ee0e-47ea-bf7b-5152879c60a4)


### Steps to reproduce

```lua

vim.cmd("set showtabline=2")

local winid = vim.api.nvim_get_current_win()
vim.print('current window on page 1 ' .. winid)
vim.cmd.tabnew()

local lines = { "Test float text" }
local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_option(bufnr, 'modifiable', true)
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(bufnr, 0, -1, false, lines)
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_option(bufnr, 'modifiable', false)

local winid2 = vim.api.nvim_get_current_win()
vim.print('current window on page 2 ' .. winid2)

vim.api.nvim_open_win(bufnr, false, { win = winid, width = 50, col = 0, row = 0, height = 1, relative = 'win' })

```

### Expected behavior

Floating relative windows should be tab page aware. 

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.9.5

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

ubuntu 22

### Terminal name/version

alacritty

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

github
title: Relative floating window rendered on wrong tab page
